levels.title: Very Easy (Basic Arithmetic & I/O)
levels.problem_description: Write a C++ program that asks the user for two integers and prints their sum.

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Does it actually add two numbers and print the result?

criteria.name: Input Handling
criteria.description: Does it use cin correctly to get two variables?

criteria.name: Syntax
criteria.description: Does it include <iostream> and compile without errors?

sample_answers.label: Correct
Logic Error
sample_answers.notes: Student uses cout << a * b; instead of +.

sample_answers.label: Syntax Error

levels.title: Easy (Control Flow & Loops)
levels.problem_description: Write a program that takes an integer N and prints the factorial of N. (Example: If N=5, output 120).

criteria.name: Loop Logic
criteria.description: Correct use of a for or while loop to multiply numbers.

criteria.name: Initialization
criteria.description: Does the factorial variable start at 1? (Starting at 0 is a common fail).

criteria.name: Edge Case
criteria.description: Does it handle 0! (which is 1) or negative numbers?

sample_answers.label: Correct
Partial
sample_answers.notes: Loop starts at 0, resulting in the answer always being 0.

sample_answers.label: Incorrect
sample_answers.notes: Prints numbers from 1 to N but doesn't multiply them.

levels.title: Medium (Arrays & Strings)
levels.problem_description: Write a function bool isPalindrome(string s) that returns true if a string reads the same forward and backward.

criteria.name: Algorithm
criteria.description: Correctly compares characters from front and back.

criteria.name: Efficiency
criteria.description: Does it avoid unnecessary extra loops?

sample_answers.label: Correct
sample_answers.notes: Correctly reverses the string and compares.

sample_answers.label: Logic Error
sample_answers.notes: Only checks the first and last letters.

sample_answers.label: Syntax Error
sample_answers.notes: Code uses char[] incorrectly and doesn't compile.

levels.title: Hard (Recursion)
levels.problem_description: Write a recursive function to find the Nth Fibonacci number.

criteria.name: Base Case
criteria.description: Checks for n <= 1 or n == 0, n == 1.

criteria.name: Recursive Step
criteria.description: Calls the function twice and adds the results.

sample_answers.label: Correct
sample_answers.notes: Uses recursion with proper base cases.

sample_answers.label: Logic Error
sample_answers.notes: Calls fibonacci(n - 1) twice instead of n - 1 and n - 2.

sample_answers.label: Syntax Error
sample_answers.notes: Missing function return type or has mismatched braces.

levels.title: Very Hard (Data Structures/Pointers)
levels.problem_description: Given a pointer to the head of a Singly Linked List, write a function to insert a new node at the end.

criteria.name: Memory Allocation
criteria.description: Uses new to create a node.

criteria.name: Traversal
criteria.description: Uses a while loop to find the end correctly.

criteria.name: Null Head Case
criteria.description: Handles the case where the list is empty (head is null).

sample_answers.label: Correct
sample_answers.notes: Allocates a new node, handles empty list, and appends at the end.

sample_answers.label: Partial
sample_answers.notes: Appends correctly but forgets to handle the null head case.

sample_answers.label: Incorrect
sample_answers.notes: Traverses the list but never links the new node.
